13.02.text:
About a year ago, my sister and her boyfriend
move into a new house in the South of Wales.

20.96.text:
After the terrible things that happened in
that place, I looked into the history of the

27.17.text: There was no known ominous past.

33.36.text:
Which makes the events that I am about to
describe all the more horrifying.

40.69.text: For a while after they moved in all was quiet.

44.58.text:
Admittedly, the property did feel strange
in itself, but we all dismissed that… that

50.91.text: was until the occurrences began to happen.

54.99.text:
It initially began when my sister claimed
her deceased boyfriend was near.

60.62.text: Her previous boyfriend had died in early 2013.

64.65.text:
The loss had affected both of our families
heavily, especially my sister.

71.05.text:
When she said that she felt his presence,
she told us that his spirit was there to protect

77.83.text:
To protect her from the darkness that lurked
in that house.

82.91.text: It was after that that things got bad.

86.90.text:
My sister told me that one day, upon entering
the house, that it was like someone, or something,

93.54.text:
was in the doorway preventing her from getting
past.

97.71.text: Almost like she was not wanted in that place.

102.14.text:
She and her boyfriend began seeing scratch
marks and blood stains on the walls.

106.86.text:
Only for them to disappear, mysteriously by
themselves, after a few days.

113.61.text:
On one occasion, my sister even found a wrench
covered in blood.

118.69.text: But that too turned up clean a few days later.

123.05.text: They could not explain what was happening.

125.46.text:
By this point, both her and her boyfriend
were very afraid.

132.24.text:
One evening I was ushered down with my mother
and stepfather because the police had been

139.04.text:
When we got there, we were told that my sister’s
friend had seen a body in the attic.

145.08.text: It had been rolled in inside of a mattress.

148.33.text:
Yet, when the police arrived, there was no
body and no mattress.

154.86.text:
My sister was in hysterics, wildly throwing
around accusations of murder, screeching that

160.64.text:
it could have been her own dead body wrapped
up in that mattress.

164.49.text: She was terrified for her life.

167.89.text:
After her outburst, the police questioned
my sister’s mental state.

172.39.text:
She underwent a mental examination the following
week, which found her to be perfectly healthy.

178.72.text:
Besides, she had not been the only one to
see and experience these things in that house.

184.87.text:
It was like whatever dwelled there was tormenting
her.

189.26.text: They moved out not long afterwards.

192.46.text:
We found out from a friend of hers that since
then no one has stayed in that house for more

201.50.text:
In the months that followed, I began to wonder
whether or not my sister truly felt her late-boyfriend’s

207.46.text:
spirit there… or whether that dark entity
had pretended to be him, so that she would

213.17.text:
open herself up and in doing so become more
vulnerable.

217.60.text:
Recently, a planchette from a Ouija board
was left on the doorstep of her new house.

224.32.text:
My sister never used a board, and didn’t
even know what the planchette was until my

230.86.text: She discarded of the thing immediately.

233.59.text:
Where it came from or how it got there is
unknown.

247.56.text:
I doubt you will get the chance to read this,
but if you do and decide to use this in a

253.33.text: video, please do not use my name.

257.47.text:
I won't bore you with all the small experiences
I have had since I was a small child, both

263.15.text:
angelic and demonic, but I will share something
that, to this day, still haunts me.

269.77.text:
It was the day that I learned curiousity does
indeed kill the cat.

275.28.text:
I have always had a slight interest in the
paranormal, ever since I had my first few

281.83.text:
inexplicable experiences, from dark entities
calling my name; to hearing deep, cold breaths;

290.40.text:
to even a gentle humming from a voice which
I can only describe as as beautiful as Mother

297.31.text:
But, I guess you could say that I started
getting more interested when I was about thirteen

304.79.text:
I loved watching series about demons and ghosts
on TV, especially A Haunting when they use

311.36.text: to show it on the Discovery Channel.

314.62.text:
I enjoyed the thrill of being scared from
it.

317.67.text:
Call me odd, but I liked it when my imagination
would scare me at night after watching these

324.20.text:
Anyway, as I became more and more interested
in the paranormal, I began watching a lot

332.58.text:
It was then that I encountered demonology
for the first time.

340.18.text:
After this, I started researching on my own,
especially about exorcisms and demonic possession.

346.71.text:
First, it was just small Wikipedia glances,
but as time went on it grew into hours of

354.85.text:
Within a year, I was researching this stuff
for around three hours on weekdays (what with

359.89.text:
school and all that), and on weekends, I would
spend up to six hours dedicated to my research.

365.85.text:
By the end of it, I knew more about the Rites
of Exorcism than was healthy for any teenager

374.59.text: However, my interest was far from sated.

379.10.text: The more I read, the more I wanted to read.

382.38.text:
What had started as curiosity had slowly morphed
into an obsession.

389.35.text:
I was being seduced by the knowledge of something
which was way beyond my comprehension.

396.22.text:
It started going bad for me when I delved
deeper into demonology, specifically, the

403.36.text:
It was the names of certain demons that enticed
me the most, mainly those within archdemon

410.63.text:
Names of pure evil which I dare not say even
here.

414.98.text:
During those times, I noticed strange things
starting to happen.

421.58.text:
I started getting less peaceful sleep, my
mind clogged with horrific thoughts and utterly

427.48.text: violent images that weren’t my own.

430.67.text:
It is a difficult feeling to describe, feeling
so completely drained of energy, my mind numbed,

442.68.text:
After more time passed, the intensity of my
experiences increased.

448.10.text:
Things within my room would move of their
own accord.

451.70.text:
I would heard odd sounds that nobody else
did.

455.23.text:
But, most terrifying of all, I felt as though
a great darkness followed me.

462.48.text:
The feeling of being watched was constant,
even as I slept.

468.67.text:
And I was not imagining this: I knew that
something was watching me.

474.37.text: However, this only added to my curiosity.

478.33.text:
So, I started researching how to contact demonic
entities.

484.75.text:
You know how they say that you should never
mention the name of a demon out loud because

489.48.text: it will grant them entrance into your life?

496.78.text:
I just wanted to see what they really looked
like, instead of them lurking in the shadows.

503.08.text:
I tried contacting them, saying their names
out loud, inviting them into my life.

510.45.text:
Even at the time, I knew that this was going
too far, that I was playing with fire.

516.12.text: But, oddly, I still wanted more.

521.19.text: For three years, this went on.

523.85.text:
By now the feeling of being watched had intensified
to the point that not a moment passed where

531.81.text:
An ever-present darkness haunted each and
every action.

537.03.text: In hindsight, I believe they were just waiting.

540.84.text:
Not in the style of "you are not yet ready"
but like that of an apex predator ready to

547.00.text:
make their kill: they can see you, but you
cannot see them, yet you feel them watching

556.28.text: They wanted to catch me when I was off guard.

560.87.text:
The first time I actually saw one of these
entities was, surprisingly enough, inside

568.83.text:
It was in shadow form, but, as strange as
it may be to hear, I knew it was a demonic

574.93.text:
For those of you who have never encountered
such a being, it is difficult for me to explain.

581.59.text:
The best way of describing it is that you
just know.

586.74.text:
Every single cell in your body just knows
and you know you cannot deny it.

596.33.text: Even after I stopped researching, they remained.

600.24.text:
I had opened the door and invited them into
my life, and that - I learnt - is a one way

607.55.text: Because of this, I constantly felt dread.

610.13.text:
Yet, I also felt utter hate, as dark thoughts
uncontrollably oppressed my mind.

617.81.text:
It was like they were trying to separate me
from who I was.

621.79.text:
I wanted it to stop, I wanted to quit, but
it was as if these beings kept forcing me

627.58.text:
to suffer because I was responsible for what
I was going through - and I knew it was true.

634.15.text:
Never did I actually speak to one of these
things.

638.27.text: And for that, I am endlessly grateful.

641.55.text:
Eventually, with time, their grip on me began
to slacken.

646.46.text:
I met a nice girl and I established a friendship
with an ordained exorcist in my diocese.

653.10.text:
Between the two of them, the darkness began
to lift: I was able to smile again and feel

661.52.text:
Ten years have passed since that time, and
the curiosity has not returned nor has the

667.92.text: oppressive presence that once plagued me.

671.24.text:
Yet, even to this day, odd things do occasionally
still happen.

675.90.text:
There are still times when I can feel eyes
watching me.

680.42.text:
It is rare and when it happens they feel distant,
but those demonic eyes remain all the same.

687.80.text: Watching me, waiting for something to happen.

691.69.text:
Although I cut my binds to those demons, they
do not accept it as true to an agreement once

699.38.text:
I do know one thing though for sure: never
again will I try to dabble with something

704.99.text:
that possesses powers beyond any comprehension
the human mind is capable of.

710.72.text: If anything, now I use what I know as a warning.

714.98.text:
There really are some things that are not
meant for us mortals to understand, no matter

720.35.text: how much information there is about it.

723.28.text:
Ultimately, the unknown is best left as the
name states: unknown.﻿

738.20.text:
When I was about 10 years of age my brother
and I lived with our great-grandparents in

745.54.text:
My mother rarely visited us, so each time
she did we were pleased to see her.

750.78.text:
However, her trip was coming to an end, and
she had just let us know that she would be

760.45.text:
I was sitting on the edge of the queen-size
bed in the master bedroom of the house, when

770.61.text:
Thinking that it was a visitor of my mother’s
in the living room, I answer, “Yes, I’m

777.67.text: The voice said, "Can you help me?

780.82.text: Can you come in front of me?"

783.30.text:
I said sure, stood up, and began to walk to
the door that connected the bedroom with the

789.78.text:
To get there I had to pass by my grandmother’s
dresser.

793.86.text:
It was old and had a large dressing mirror
on top of it.

798.08.text:
As I passed by, I caught sight of something
in the corner of my eye.

802.48.text:
There was a woman in the mirror, looking at
me.

806.85.text:
Admittedly, I had been sick lately (just having
recovered from the Measles) so I wasn't sure

821.37.text:
The apparition had a presence of evil about
her which made me sit down on the end of the

826.26.text: bed so that I wouldn't fall down.

830.11.text:
I summoned up my courage, soothed by my faith
in Jesus.

833.68.text:
Since I was a church going Christian, I knew
that He would protect me from the Devil and

839.62.text: I glanced up at her again.

841.77.text:
Her hair was fashioned in such a way that
did not belong to this time.

845.41.text:
If I had to guess, I would place her in the
18th century.

851.99.text:
The woman in the mirror asked me if I believed
in ghosts.

856.23.text:
Cautious in my response to this strange figure,
I told her that I had never met one, but had

863.35.text:
Then, slightly fearful and lingering over
my words, I asked her if that was what she

871.40.text:
She responded by saying that she was looking
for a way to move on, as she had died nearby

878.56.text: Again she asked me: "Can you help me?"

881.93.text: I don’t remember the entire conversation.

884.62.text:
However, after all these years her final statement
has stayed with me.

889.51.text: She said that she was going to kill me.

893.79.text:
She had no choice, she said, as people who
met ghosts weren’t allowed to live to tell

900.18.text:
Panicking, I remember jumbling together a
sad story about my life.

904.88.text: That I was miserable and neglected by my mother.

908.37.text:
That I had no friends and that no one liked
me.

910.83.text: Parts of it were true, parts of it were not.

914.61.text:
I hoped that my plight would make her feel
sympathy and that she might spare me.

920.41.text:
I told her that she was the only person who
had talked to me in a long time.

925.05.text: That I would like to help her and be her friend.

929.32.text: She did not respond right away.

931.49.text:
Eventually, she told me she was going to have
to leave now, but would return again to talk

936.38.text: with me some more another time.

938.97.text: It was then that my mother came into the bedroom.

941.83.text:
She shooed me out as she wanted to take a
nap.

944.89.text:
I was in the living room when I heard a horrifying
scream.

948.73.text:
My mother came running out of the room, visibly
shaken.

952.78.text: My great-grandmother asked her what was wrong.

955.56.text:
My mother answered replied: "There was a woman
in the mirror."

959.56.text:
We all went into the bedroom together and
looked at the mirror.

965.04.text: But, I knew who my mother had seen.

968.66.text:
My mother refused to sleep in that bedroom
after that, and so took my bed.

973.65.text:
Since I had lied and told her I hadn't seen
anything, she said that I could sleep in the

979.72.text:
A queen-size bed, I thought, not really a
punishment.

985.06.text: Besides, I had already made a plan.

988.17.text:
I had originally spoke with my minister on
the phone about the woman in the mirror, but

992.59.text:
he told me such things were just nonsense,
and said it was probably because of the kind

999.46.text:
I knew that I would have to deal with this
myself.

1002.85.text:
I spoke with the ghostly woman two more times,
giving her sob stories and mock despair each

1009.79.text:
When the weekend came, I finally found the
time to ride my bicycle down to the local

1015.71.text: I filled a bottle with holy water.

1018.26.text:
I took the water home and went to the mirror
where I splashed it in the shape of a cross.

1023.67.text: After that, I never saw her again.

1027.55.text:
Recently, I read a book titled ‘Deliver
us from Evil’, written by a New York police

1034.81.text:
In the book they documented a case of a demonic
entity appearing as a woman in the mirror

1039.31.text: of a family that they were helping.

1041.65.text:
It left me wondering if they had met the same
apparition I had...

1057.32.text:
About a month ago, I moved into a moderately-sized
apartment with the love of my life, Thomas,

1064.13.text: and his pre-school aged step-daughter, Daisy.

1068.12.text:
The move came as a huge relief to the both
of us: we were thrilled to finally be living

1075.17.text:
Daisy was also ecstatic to now have her own
"big girl room" where she could play and enjoy

1083.23.text:
Moving can certainly be a stressful experience,
having to uproot every single belonging and

1089.05.text:
haul everything multiple times, only to then
settle yourself in an unfamiliar space.

1095.85.text:
So naturally, when things turned up in places
other than where I had left them, I was quick

1101.23.text: to dismiss it as "the chaos of the move".

1104.50.text:
I also attributed crankiness, short tempers,
and the general feeling of uneasiness to being

1113.15.text:
Even after what happened during our first
night there.

1117.66.text:
I had been asleep for several hours, when
- around half four in the morning - I was

1122.77.text: jolted awake by the sound of a woman gasping.

1127.16.text:
It startled me so much that I instantly sat
upright, flinging the covers from myself as

1135.75.text:
I surveyed my surroundings: bed, dresser,
and lots of boxes.

1142.51.text:
Eventually, my eyes adjusted to the darkness
and I was able to see Thomas lying next to

1148.66.text:
The moment I focused on his sleeping form,
he rolled over, lifted his head, and looked

1155.75.text: Only, his eyes were firmly closed.

1158.95.text:
Regardless, the intensity of his eyeless stare
burned into me, as his face formed an expression

1171.24.text:
Against every shaken fiber of my being, I
laid back down in attempt to lull him out

1176.31.text: of whatever dream he was in.

1178.39.text:
At that point, his head snapped to the side,
our noses almost touching.

1184.01.text:
He wiggled his eyebrows, as if he was going
to try to make a joke.

1188.75.text:
Chillingly, still seemingly asleep, he let
out a little laugh and uttered: "How scared

1194.80.text:
After that, like a 
spell had been broken, he fell back into rest.

1204.67.text: I couldn't blink, or breathe, or even cry.

1208.01.text:
It was all so startling, and on top of that
I was completely exhausted.

1213.97.text:
At some point between 5 and 6, I finally fell
asleep.

1218.68.text:
The next day, thinking about what had happened
the night before, all seemed so surreal.

1226.76.text:
I decided to attribute the whole ordeal to
a waking dream.

1230.63.text:
We had so much to do, and I didn't have time
to dwell on it.

1235.74.text:
We quickly got the apartment settled over
the weekend.

1239.00.text:
As Daisy would be returning from a sleepover
on Sunday evening, I wanted everything to

1243.71.text: be perfect for her when she arrived.

1245.86.text:
So, I did the grocery shopping, decorated
her room into something very aesthetically

1251.09.text:
pleasing for a 4 year old, and busied myself
with fine-tuning her new home.

1256.55.text:
Her first night there was a rousing success:
she fell in love with the place just as her

1264.33.text:
That, I'm comfortable to say, was the biggest
sigh of relief of all.

1271.16.text:
The "chaos of the move" was through, and we
could resume our normality: work, school,

1279.42.text:
The next week was largely uneventful, with
the occasional instance of "how did this box

1284.89.text:
end up in here?" and "who left that light
on?".

1289.06.text:
Menial things that nobody ever pays much attention
to.

1297.25.text:
The next weekend we hosted a party so that
my family could see our new home.

1302.69.text:
The apartment was a big hit with everybody,
with the exception of my grandmother.

1308.64.text:
She had walked around the house with a skeptical
eye, occasionally glancing over her shoulder,

1314.38.text: and checking in cupboards and behind doors.

1317.60.text:
Although she is a very interesting lady, my
grandmother is also very eccentric, so I didn't

1323.52.text: pay much attention to her suspicious glances.

1326.61.text:
However, when we all finally sat down for
dinner, throughout the entire meal my attention

1332.41.text:
was pulled away, time and time again, by my
grandmother.

1337.24.text:
She sat at the end of the table, silently,
gazing with great intention at our sliding

1344.63.text:
After watching her do this for several minutes,
I finally asked her what was so interesting

1351.41.text:
She acted like I had startled her out of some
kind of trance.

1355.87.text:
Looking at me she said, "I keep seeing your
white cat in the reflection, you didn't tell

1361.36.text: me you bought a new cat."

1365.85.text: I leered over the table, into the living room.

1371.16.text:
She quickly dismissed the comments as a product
of a 'senior moment', and our happy evening

1377.29.text: But the white cat stuck in my memory.

1381.72.text:
Later that evening, after I had cleaned up
the post-party mess, I began building a fire

1389.46.text: The three of us were due to relax.

1391.72.text:
When, out of the corner of my eye, it was
there.

1398.00.text:
It was big and as fast as a shot, darting
under my table and away to the patio door.

1403.19.text:
I nearly fell over trying to stand, and give
chase to the stowaway animal, but when I ran

1409.13.text:
over to where he had gone, there was no sign
of any animal.

1413.93.text:
Afterwards, when we had settled in for our
movie, I told Thomas that I, too, had seen

1424.43.text:
Being skeptical of anything paranormal, he
shrugged it off with a rational explanation,

1430.22.text:
suggesting that I should not dwell on a supposed
phantom cat.

1436.36.text:
We both chuckled at the concept and said that
a cat ghost wouldn't be such a terrible inconvenience

1442.37.text:
in our home anyway, when - suddenly - Thomas
leapt up off the couch.

1448.31.text:
He scolded me, saying that there was no cat,
and there was no reason for me to be going

1453.43.text: to such lengths to scare him.

1456.23.text: I was confused to say the least.

1458.33.text:
"I know that you believe in this stuff, but
I don't.

1461.91.text:
You don't need to brush stuff against my leg
and try to get a rise out of me."

1466.32.text: But, I had never touched him.

1469.30.text:
Besides, I was sitting at least 3 feet away,
with Daisy between us.

1475.85.text:
Realising that I couldn’t have touched him,
confusion washed over Thomas’ face.

1481.73.text: He quietly apologized and sat back down.

1485.19.text:
The expression of shock and wondering stayed
on his face for a little while.

1491.59.text:
When the movie was over, and everyone was
in bed, I had trouble finding sleep.

1497.34.text:
I faded in and out of dreams of the white
cat, and dreams of a woman that looked very

1505.06.text: The dreams were bizarre to say the least.

1507.97.text:
The woman who looked like me would laugh and
howl, then scrape dirt up out of the ground

1513.13.text: and stuff it into her face.

1515.86.text:
Each time that she did, I would choke and
spit and gasp for air.

1522.53.text:
She would just howl and laugh and scoop up
another handful of dirt.

1527.39.text: Needless to say, I did not sleep well.

1534.37.text:
The next morning, Thomas was on shift to get
Daisy out of bed.

1538.51.text:
As he did, I dozed, sleepily listening to
them moving around the house.

1544.72.text:
I had faded back into light sleep when I was
awoken by hurried footsteps coming up the

1551.19.text:
Thomas grabbed my shoulder, and shook it gently,
asking: "How did you do that?

1561.27.text:
Sitting up, I asked him to explain what had
happened.

1564.89.text: This is what he told me:

1567.21.text:
He had been helping Daisy pull her pajamas
down so she could use the bathroom when she

1571.74.text:
had pointed out the door and said: “There
goes Lovie!

1577.22.text:
Lovie was a pet name that she's always had
for me.

1580.47.text:
When Thomas looked out the door and saw nothing,
he had replied: “Where is Lovie?

1586.44.text:
Yet, Daisy had pointed her finger out the
door and insisted, “YES DADDY, SHE'S RIGHT

1593.55.text:
It was then that Thomas saw ‘me’ walking
through the living room into the kitchen.

1602.72.text:
Whatever this thing was, it was a carbon copy
of me.

1607.71.text:
Thomas went on to explain that he and Daisy
had gone into the living room to follow ‘me’.

1612.76.text:
“Lovie is hiding in the kitchen,” Thomas
had said, “she's gonna pop out and scare

1619.95.text:
Thinking it was a game, Daisy had took off
back to her room.

1624.24.text:
Thomas had snuck around to the kitchen threshhold,
as this was the only place where someone could

1631.40.text:
Yet, when he looked inside, ‘I’ had not
been there.

1635.83.text:
Only, it hadn’t been ‘me’ in the first
place.

1639.66.text: As I had been dozing in bed the entire time.

1644.21.text:
It took about 10 minutes of me swearing up
and down that I had been in bed the whole

1648.56.text:
time before Thomas realized that I was telling
the truth.

1652.75.text:
I hadn't teleported out of there, I was never
there to begin with.

1657.49.text: Whatever he and Daisy saw wasn't me.

1660.89.text:
I instantly thought of the dreams that had
plagued me that night.

1664.19.text:
Of the woman who looked just like me, the
howling woman.

1669.46.text: Just thinking about this made my stomach sink.

1674.01.text:
After this, I thought that there was something
wrong with our apartment.

1677.60.text:
Yet, within just a few days I knew I was proven
wrong.

1683.30.text:
Whatever was happening wasn’t confined to
the apartment anymore.

1688.71.text:
As I sat at my desk late one afternoon, wrapping
up the day’s activities, I heard the front

1694.41.text:
door to the office open and my managers hurry
inside.

1698.93.text:
This wasn't at all odd for me: midwestern
November weather is, if nothing else, windy

1705.62.text:
Yet, when they stepped into the area in front
of my cubicle, I knew something was wrong.

1712.03.text:
When I saw the expression on their faces,
I was taken back to Thomas’ face the previous

1721.02.text:
They both started to speak to me all at once,
loud and agitated.

1729.98.text:
Did they see a car accident on their smoke
break?

1734.90.text:
Finally, one of my managers, Kelly, was able
to articulate her thoughts: "Where did you

1744.85.text:
She was not asking, she was demanding - shock
painted across her face.

1751.69.text:
When my answers did not satisfy her (I hadn’t
been outside for hours) her demeanor changed

1762.90.text: How the Hell did you get in here so quickly?”

1766.56.text:
At that moment, the cold, sinking feeling
from the weekend before returned to my stomach.

1776.01.text:
After a coworker verified this, my managers
finally stopped shouting at me.

1781.43.text:
The realisation hit that there was no joke
or lie being played out.

1786.86.text:
My other manager, Mary, explained that she
and Kelly had seen ‘me’ absent mindedly

1792.04.text: pacing through the parking lot outside.

1794.52.text:
‘I’ was faced away from them, with ‘my’
hands folded up in a praying position under

1801.04.text:
This is a particular quirk of mine, I'll often
weave my fingers together and rest my chin

1807.30.text: It’s something I've always done it.

1809.58.text:
Yet, once again, whatever they saw outside
wasn’t ‘me’.

1815.48.text:
Kelly and Mary continued to provide precise
details of this thing outside.

1821.35.text:
Not only did it mimic my hand movements, but
it also walked like me, copying my absent-minded

1828.24.text:
habit of stretching my legs by rolling from
my heel to my toe to come up on top my tiptoes.

1834.97.text:
It was even dressed in the same hiking boots,
leggings and college basketball sweater that

1842.59.text:
Every detail matched perfectly, except for
one.

1848.12.text:
Throughout this whole conversation, Kelly
kept returning to the same thing, the reason

1852.92.text:
why she thought ‘I’ had been trying to
scare them.

1855.77.text:
As this thing paced the parking lot, mimicking
me in every way, it made noises like a cat.

1864.43.text:
As the reality set in that whatever had been
seen outside wasn’t actually me, nobody

1872.04.text:
Instead, two very calmly voiced questions
hung in the air: First, if it wasn't me, then

1880.95.text: And, secondly, is it still out there?

1885.55.text:
I poked my head out the door and scanned the
parking lot before slowly walked outside into

1892.32.text:
As I approached my car, I prayed that this
thing was long gone.

1896.71.text:
I couldn’t begin to imagine running into
it, mirroring my image, dressed up as me.

1903.13.text:
When I was safely inside of the car, my phone
rang.

1909.79.text:
He had arrived at the apartment about 10 minutes
beforehand and, as he explained it to me,

1915.83.text:
every ceiling light that he tried to turn
on had popped a light bulb.

1921.38.text:
When he had returned to the kitchen for new
bulbs, he had suddenly heard sprinting feet

1927.63.text:
Not hurried steps or even a hustle, but the
loud steps of somebody charging you with a

1938.02.text:
His military training took over, and at the
prospect of having a violent intruder in the

1942.47.text:
house, he grabbed a ceramic knife from the
counter.

1946.08.text:
Yet, when he had ducked and turned to face
the assailant, there was nobody there.

1951.36.text: There was nobody in the kitchen.

1954.33.text: There was nobody in the apartment.

1956.96.text:
In fact, there was not even anybody in the
complex hall or out the main door.

1963.54.text:
After I told him about the happenings at work,
the only response that he could muster was:

1968.53.text: "Let's get out of the house tonight.

1970.74.text: Let's go see our parents, or your grandma.

1973.32.text: Let's get out of the house."

1976.08.text: That was an idea I got behind.

1979.60.text:
When I arrived home he met me at the garden
gate with a collection of belongings.

1987.23.text:
We thought that being at someone else’s
home would give us a small reprieve.

1991.97.text: However, that thought was short lived.

1995.22.text:
At Thomas’ mother's house, a closet door
opened, and then shut, seemingly of its own

2002.96.text:
Also, a foul smell seeped into the house,
almost as soon as we set foot through the

2009.41.text:
I've seen enough horror movies to draw conclusions
from these events: we decided that we ought

2016.29.text:
Thomas’ mother shared in our confusion and
fear.

2019.79.text: Ultimately unable to help, she hugged us goodbye.

2023.87.text:
As we drove away, I looked on as every window
of her house lit up, as every source of light

2029.59.text: in the building was switched on.

2035.66.text:
As we walked in her door, yet another light
bulb exploded, not two feet from Thomas’

2042.06.text:
We both rushed inside, thinking we could leave
the presence out on the porch if we closed

2049.72.text:
Having seen the white cat at the housewarming
party, my grandmother was concerned.

2055.59.text:
She placed her hands on my shoulder and told
me that I needed to cleanse the house.

2061.98.text:
She gave us a couple of white candles and
instructed us to both leave our Bibles open

2067.61.text: where the bulk of the activity was happening.

2070.31.text:
Yet, as much as I clung to those white candles,
they did nothing to relieve the situation.

2077.91.text:
Neither did the advice from an old friend
of mine, who has experience with spirit communications.

2086.08.text: Strange things still happen in my house.

2088.89.text: And, I am still haunted by my doppelganger.

2092.83.text:
This thing seems to take delight in following
us everywhere, and scaring not only us, but

2099.13.text: everyone we come into contact with.

2101.99.text:
I do not know what it is, I can only describe
it as some kind or dark presence.

2108.43.text: It’s intentions are far from pleasant.

2111.94.text:
It terrifies me, and I feel unwelcome in my
own home.

2116.97.text: Like I am being forced out.

2121.78.text:
Whatever is in my apartment doesn't plan on
leaving anytime soon.

2131.20.text:
If you enjoyed this, please like and subscribe
for more of the paranormal.

2136.21.text:
And, if you have not done so already, please
click the ‘bell’ to ensure that you receive

2143.58.text:
Finally, if you have a paranormal experience
that you would like me to narrate, we would

2148.62.text:
love to hear from you via email or Facebook
message.
